formattedAddress: 468 W 143rd St, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 468 W 143rd St, New York, NY 10031, USA

originalText.text: I love this school! Our daughter is in her 6th year at OLL. The faculty and administration are always respectful to her and truly care about her. Her class is terrific and the kids seem to really care about each other. She is challenged academically, spiritually and socially. Their art, music and language  programs are a great asset as is their affordable and expanding aftercare program. I volunteered to start a parent group here because that's all I could see that was missing. It's growing and bringing more opportunities to our school. We feel blessed to have our daughter learning in such a safe and nurturing environment.

originalText.text: My daughter attended OLL this year for PreK3 and it has proven to be the right choice for our family.  The teachers and staff are the heart of this school, it is a family, you feel that from the moment you walk-in.  The administration has the best interest of students and their families in mind at all times.  I have looked at many schools, I toured 10 before selecting OLL.  The key is the administrations ability to listen to programming suggestions.  The enrichment offerings and the plans for the next five years are impressive, there is no school - certainly in this area -offering a fraction of the programs OLL offers.  If you are looking for private school education in NYC - OLL is worth strongly considering.

originalText.text: I have had all 4 of my kids go through this school. My 3 girls and my son have all gone there the youngest my son who is 10 has another 3 years and that will total about 20 years of history with us there. The staff is wonderful very attentive and they work individually with each child. Mrs. Hufnagel the principal is wonderful and Hope and Pray that Mrs. Velazquel never retires she will totally transform your child along with many other wonderful teachers there! I can go on and on but you can go in and get a tour!

originalText.text: I went on a tour of the school a few weeks ago and I was very amazed of how the children in the kindergarten class was so full of energy ready to learn and answer questions. The teacher seems to love teaching and has great interaction with the children. All the staff that I met were very welcoming. I attended an interview yesterday with my daughter and so happy that she was accepted.

originalText.text: My daughter has attended Our Lady of Lourdes for the past 4 years and she is thriving both socially and academically. The teachers have been great and play an important role in my daughter's success. The principle has demonstrated leadership and works tirelessly to keep the school humming which is important especially amidst other Catholic school closings. They also have a breakfast and after school program which has been beneficial.
